question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 and (b) the United Food and Commercial Workers not endorse any candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

1. Google resolves a major workers' strike by reaching an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

2. The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) does not publicly endorse any candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. This will be based on the absence of official UFCW statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal) confirming an endorsement.

If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The United Food and Commercial Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, or (b) Google resolve a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorse a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Food and Agriculture Organization announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024, and (b) The Reserve Bank of India refrain from imposing new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) does not announce any new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. This includes the absence of any official statements from the RBI or reports by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard) confirming such curbs. If no new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, this part resolves as YES. If new curbs are announced and confirmed, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES. If either part resolves as NO, the overall question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024, or will the Food and Agriculture Organization announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If neither of these conditions is met by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Georgia holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 (b) New York does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Georgia officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be formally announced by the Georgia state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Georgia-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Georgia and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will be considered not met.

(b) New York does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. This condition will be met if:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   
This question will resolve as NO if either Georgia does not hold the specified referendum by July 31, 2024, or New York does hold such a referendum by August 31, 2024, or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either New York or Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

1. New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
   - The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. Georgia conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution by July 31, 2024. For a positive resolution:
   - The referendum must be formally announced by the Georgia state government.
   - The referendum must be verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Georgia-based news outlets).
   - The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Georgia and focus primarily on abortion rights.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of these referendums occurs by their respective deadlines, or if any planned referendum is canceled or postponed beyond the specified dates.

question.title: Will Washington's Medicaid expansion program enroll over 450,000 people by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Washington's Medicaid expansion program has enrolled more than 450,000 residents by July 31, 2024. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the enrollment does not exceed 450,000 by the resolution date, or if reliable data is not available, the question resolves as NO. The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia announces an interest rate cut and (b) Washington's Medicaid expansion program enrolls 450,000 people or fewer?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. (b) Washington's Medicaid expansion program has enrolled 450,000 residents or fewer. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Washington's Medicaid expansion program enrolls over 450,000 people or (b) The Reserve Bank of Australia announces an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Washington's Medicaid expansion program enrolls more than 450,000 residents. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid. (b) The Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If neither event occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receive European conditional marketing approval by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receives conditional marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly rejects the approval, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is based on the regulatory process as of October 1, 2023, and does not take into account any specific committee recommendations or decisions made after this date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major diabetes medication by August 2024 and (b) Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi does not receive European conditional marketing approval by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) The newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare include a major diabetes medication, confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. This must be confirmed by official announcements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal).
(b) Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi does not receive conditional marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024, or the EMA explicitly rejects the approval. This must be confirmed by the absence of an official announcement by the EMA and not reported by at least two reputable news sources. 
If both (a) and (b) occur as described, the question resolves as YES. If either (a) or (b) does not occur as described, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receives European conditional marketing approval, or (b) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major diabetes medication?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receives conditional marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly rejects the approval, this part resolves as NO. (b) The newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as announced by the Biden administration, include a major diabetes medication and are confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency, and the inclusion must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the medication is not included in the negotiated prices by this date, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Large protests in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation, and (b) Alibaba Group not resolving a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) Alibaba Group does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation or non-resolution of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this part of the question to resolve as YES, the strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and no resolution is confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union. The non-resolution or continuation of the strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part of the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either a major workers' strike be resolved by Alibaba Group or large protests occur in Indonesia due to religious freedom legislation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. The protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia and be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Fisker receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024, and will the Central Bank of Mexico refrain from announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, this condition is not met. (2) The Central Bank of Mexico does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If there is no such announcement confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials by the resolution date, this condition is met. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy. If both conditions are satisfied as specified, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024, or Fisker receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives by July 31, 2024. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If neither of these conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Washington Lottery offer online products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Washington Lottery has officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Washington Lottery or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as local Washington newspapers, national news outlets, or industry-specific publications). The online products must be accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a YES resolution. If the Washington Lottery does not offer online products meeting these criteria by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Google resolves a major workers' strike (b) The Washington Lottery does not offer online products?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Google resolves a major workers' strike: This requires Google to reach an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike involving at least 1,000 participants and lasting for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) The Washington Lottery does not offer online products: This requires that the Washington Lottery has not officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. There must be no confirmation from an official announcement by the Washington Lottery or reports from at least two reputable news sources that the online products are accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Washington Lottery offers online products, or (b) Google resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Washington Lottery officially launches any of its products for online purchase or play. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Washington Lottery or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as local Washington newspapers, national news outlets, or industry-specific publications). The online products must be accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a YES resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If neither of these events meeting the specified criteria occurs by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the lawsuit against Massachusetts' initiative on crisis pregnancy centers be ongoing in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the lawsuit filed by a conservative law firm against Massachusetts' initiative targeting crisis pregnancy centers is still ongoing in court. The status of the lawsuit must be confirmed through official court documents or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the lawsuit has been dismissed, settled, or reached a final judgment by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'ongoing' means the case is still in active litigation, including any appeals process.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Alabama enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024, and (b) the lawsuit against Massachusetts' initiative on crisis pregnancy centers is dismissed, settled, or reaches a final judgment by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Alabama enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part will resolve as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the lawsuit filed by a conservative law firm against Massachusetts' initiative targeting crisis pregnancy centers is dismissed, settled, or reaches a final judgment. The status of the lawsuit must be confirmed through official court documents or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the lawsuit is still ongoing in court, including any appeals process, by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'dismissed, settled, or reached a final judgment' means the case is no longer in active litigation. If both parts resolve as YES, the overall question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) The lawsuit against Massachusetts' initiative on crisis pregnancy centers be ongoing in August 2024, or (b) Alabama enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: (a) The question about Massachusetts resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the lawsuit filed by a conservative law firm against Massachusetts' initiative targeting crisis pregnancy centers is still ongoing in court. The status of the lawsuit must be confirmed through official court documents or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the lawsuit has been dismissed, settled, or reached a final judgment by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'ongoing' means the case is still in active litigation, including any appeals process. (b) The question about Alabama resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alabama enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Huawei announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Huawei officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Huawei's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Twitter announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce AND (b) Huawei does NOT announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (a) Twitter publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Twitter only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, this part resolves as NO. Note that this part is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans. (b) Huawei does NOT officially announce specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. This means no announcement is made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times) regarding concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Huawei's AI systems. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, and the measures specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either Huawei announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption or Twitter announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Huawei officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Huawei's AI systems. (b) Twitter publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If neither announcement is made by the specified date, or if the respective conditions for each announcement are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If no additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, or if the implementations are for different waiting periods, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ohio removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024 (b) No additional U.S. state implements a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, this part resolves as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, no additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. If any additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024, or Ohio remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. (b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major cholesterol medication by August 2024, and (b) U.S. previously occupied home sales fail to increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: (a) This part resolves as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare include a major cholesterol medication confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must be reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal. (b) This part resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are not three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. The combined question resolves as YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024, or (b) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major cholesterol medication by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month, verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts, with increases reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, and (b) The French economy enters a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). (b) The French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If one or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota does not officially conduct a referendum regarding housing affordability. If either of these conditions is not met by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024 or the HHS's rule on telehealth services be enacted by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mississippi hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 and (b) Facebook's AI content moderation system not be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Mississippi officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws, must be officially announced by the Mississippi state government, and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as YES. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.

question.title: Will YouTube face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government, and (b) YouTube avoids additional legal actions from the U.S. government?

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The United States announces plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two, and (2) The United Auto Workers do not endorse a Republican candidate for president?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on tax reform by August 2024, and will New York not hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by July 2024?

The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address tax reform, either proposing new tax policies or modifying existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on tax does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, this condition resolves as NO. (2) By July 31, 2024, the state of New York does not officially conduct a referendum regarding the legalization of marijuana. This includes scenarios where no referendum is planned, a planned referendum is cancelled, or a planned referendum is postponed beyond July 31, 2024. The non-occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through the absence of official state government announcements or the lack of reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN) regarding such a referendum by the specified date. Note that this condition only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome. The question resolves as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are satisfied; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims never exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, and (b) Google fails to reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority?
question.body:
(a) The European Commission must officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels by August 31, 2024. This implementation must be confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist. The tariff must specifically target solar panels manufactured in China and not be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

(b) Google and the UK data protection authority must not reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations by August 31, 2024. There must be no official statements from either party or reports by at least two reputable news sources confirming such a settlement. The lack of settlement should specifically relate to the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will either Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority or the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 2024, and (b) The Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, meaning no official communications such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials confirm such an announcement by the resolution date. question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut, or (b) The German economy avoids a recession?

The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that no such code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if either:

1. No such referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, or a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

question.title: Will either an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024, or will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution: 1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government. 2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection. 3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. The question will resolve as NO if: 1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024. 2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date. 3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights. Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Canadian economy avoids a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, or (b) The Canadian economy avoids a recession?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: 
(a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year in its official financial statements. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO. Note that this does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.
(b) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For this purpose, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid: 
1. A strike involving a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants) does not end with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must last for at least one week if it occurs. 
3. The lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The lack of resolution or the absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.

   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce).
   - The tariff's existence must be corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times).
   If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this part.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024, and (b) the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate falls below 13.25% at any point in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike. (b) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike?

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce results in more than 10 confirmed deaths, and (b) Sara Lee does not issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. Only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

(b) Sara Lee does not officially announce a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The absence of a recall must be confirmed by the lack of any of the following sources:
   1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
   2. A press release from Sara Lee
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak, or (b) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths?

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024 and (2) Andrew Bailey not remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. (2) Andrew Bailey is no longer serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on or before July 31, 2024, for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term). Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is still serving as Governor by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position. If both conditions are met by their respective resolution dates, this question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024 or a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points, and (b) a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio is not canceled?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: 

(a) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange.

(b) The South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has not been officially canceled by August 31, 2024. The project must still be ongoing, under review, or not officially canceled by this date. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the project is officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'not canceled' means the company has not formally withdrawn its plans and the state has not definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will either a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024, or will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
