question.title: Will Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If no such approval is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the agreement is rejected, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of the Philippines announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) Universal Studios Hollywood workers do not approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy. (b) By July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations do not approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The lack of approval must be confirmed by the absence of official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) confirming the approval. The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either a new labor agreement be approved by Universal Studios Hollywood workers by July 2024, or will the Central Bank of the Philippines announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (1) By July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook implements any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in ad targeting, pricing models, or advertiser agreements. If no such changes are implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) New York conducts a referendum on abortion rights and (b) Facebook does not implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights. For a YES resolution on this part, the following criteria must be met:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   - The referendum must occur by August 31, 2024.
   - Merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. Facebook does not implement any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. For a YES resolution on this part, the following criteria must be met:
   - No changes to Facebook's advertising policies are implemented by August 31, 2024.
   - The lack of implementation must be confirmed by the absence of official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reports by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).
   - This question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

If both of these conditions are met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Facebook implements court-ordered changes to its advertising policies, or (b) New York conducts a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Facebook implements any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in ad targeting, pricing models, or advertiser agreements. Note that this question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

(b) New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York, the primary focus must be on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. Merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Mercedes-Benz's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The U.S. government initiates a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project, and (2) Mercedes-Benz does not receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

1. The U.S. government initiates a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project. For this to occur, the following criteria must be satisfied:
   - The legal challenge must be officially filed in a U.S. court.
   - The challenge must be specifically against a renewable energy project.
   - The legal action must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets.
   - The challenge must be new, initiated after October 1, 2023.

2. Mercedes-Benz is not confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. This condition is satisfied if:
   - There is no official government announcement, Mercedes-Benz's official statement, or report from at least three major news organizations confirming receipt of more than $500 million.
   - The grants are not specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects or the confirmed amount is $500 million or less.

If both conditions are satisfied by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Mercedes-Benz receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives or the U.S. government initiate a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Mercedes-Benz's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes.

(b) The U.S. government initiates a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project. The legal challenge must be officially filed in a U.S. court, specifically against a renewable energy project, and reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets.

If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will New Jersey hold a referendum on affordable housing by July 2024, and will New York not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, New Jersey holds a referendum on enshrining affordable housing in its state constitution. The occurrence must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the protection of affordable housing in the state constitution. If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional protection of affordable housing, this condition resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, New York does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For this condition to resolve as YES, any of the following criteria must be met:

1. No referendum is officially announced and conducted by the state of New York by the specified date.
2. The primary focus of the referendum is not on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results are not publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date qualifies for a YES resolution.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

question.title: Will either New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or New Jersey hold a referendum on affordable housing by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs:

1. By August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state, meeting all of the following criteria:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. By July 31, 2024, New Jersey holds a referendum on enshrining affordable housing in its state constitution, confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the protection of affordable housing in the state constitution.

If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Arizona by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Arizona. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Wisconsin holds a referendum on public school funding (b) President Biden does not deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Arizona?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The state of Wisconsin officially conducts a referendum regarding public school funding. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing public school funding. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Note that this part only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome. (b) President Joe Biden does not deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Arizona. The absence of such a speech must be confirmed by the lack of official White House announcements and reports from at least two reputable news sources. If such a speech occurs by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur by July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will either President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Arizona or Wisconsin hold a referendum on public school funding by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Arizona. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. (b) The state of Wisconsin officially conducts a referendum regarding public school funding. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing public school funding, verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If neither event occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Ketchikan, Alaska, vote to restrict cruise ship docking to weekdays only by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city of Ketchikan, Alaska, has held an official vote (either by city council or public referendum) on restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and the outcome of this vote is in favor of such a restriction. The vote must be specifically about restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, not a general restriction on cruise ships. The result of the vote must be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Alaskan news outlets). If no such vote has taken place, or if a vote occurs but does not result in approval of the weekday-only restriction, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question is about the vote itself, not the implementation of the restriction.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) Large protests occur in Canada in response to environmental policy changes, and (2) Ketchikan, Alaska, does not vote to restrict cruise ship docking to weekdays only?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets of large protests in Canada specifically in response to the government's decision to change environmental policies. These protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Canada and must be explicitly linked to the issue of environmental policy changes. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the policy change is rescinded before causing such protests, this part will resolve as NO. (2) The city of Ketchikan, Alaska, has not held an official vote (either by city council or public referendum) on restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, or if the outcome of such a vote is not in favor of the restriction. The vote must be specifically about restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only and not a general restriction on cruise ships. The result of the vote must be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If a vote has taken place and results in approval of the weekday-only restriction, this part will resolve as NO. Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Ketchikan, Alaska, votes to restrict cruise ship docking to weekdays only, or (b) large protests occur in Canada in response to environmental policy changes?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The city of Ketchikan, Alaska, holds an official vote (either by city council or public referendum) on restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and the outcome of this vote is in favor of such a restriction. The vote must be specifically about restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and the result must be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Alaskan news outlets). (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Canada specifically in response to the government's decision to change environmental policies. The protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Canada, and must be explicitly linked to the issue of environmental policy changes. If neither event occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The FDA issues a recall for ground ginger products due to lead contamination by July 2024 (b) Hillshire Farm does not issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. By August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm does not officially announce a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. This means that none of the following sources confirm a recall:
   - An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
   - A press release from Hillshire Farm
   - An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
   - Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

If no recall explicitly mentioning listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as YES.

The question resolves as NO if either of the conditions is not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024 (b) The FDA issue a recall for ground ginger products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. This recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources: an official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels, a press release from Hillshire Farm, an announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall, or reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources. The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. This recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

question.title: Will Zoom lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) PayPal lays off at least 1,800 employees, and (b) Zoom lays off fewer than 1,800 employees, as part of their respective AI-focused reorganization plans?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (1) PayPal has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. (2) Zoom has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This includes scenarios where Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation of layoffs must still come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), and the layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If both conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Zoom or PayPal lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Zoom or PayPal has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of their respective AI-focused reorganization plans. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plans announced in 2023. If neither company confirms layoffs meeting these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date for either company will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made footwear through August 2024 AND reduce or remove the 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles before September 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. (2) At any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the United States reduces the tariff below 100% or completely removes it on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The change in the tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. If the 100% tariff on textiles is maintained continuously through August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. The question will resolve as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or footwear through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of either Chinese-made textiles or Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariffs must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or Chinese-made footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO for that category. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariffs that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights and (b) Kansas does not hold a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. (b) Kansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For this condition to be met, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The non-occurrence or lack of results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Kansas or Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Kansas or Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. 

For Kansas: The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. It must be officially announced by the Kansas state government, with the voting process completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). Merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

For Michigan: The referendum must be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). It must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, it will resolve as NO.

If either state completes such a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If neither state conducts a referendum by this date, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Apple Inc. resolves a major workers' strike and (b) Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enrolls fewer than 25,000 beneficiaries?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the condition is not met.

(b) Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, enrolls fewer than 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is at least 25,000 by the resolution date, and the work requirement is not removed from the plan, the condition is not met. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

Only if both (a) and (b) occur as described will the question resolve as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Virginia's Medicaid plan enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries or Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, enrolls at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

(b) Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid: The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Michigan remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) Michigan keep the work requirement in its Medicaid plan past July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as YES if the Bank of Canada officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Canada communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight rate, which is the Bank of Canada's primary tool for monetary policy.

(b) This part resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan does not officially announce the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. If the work requirement remains in place or if no official state announcements or reports by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) confirm its removal, this part resolves as YES. The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If the work requirement is removed by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Michigan remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024, or the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. This change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (b) The Bank of Canada officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Canada communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight rate, which is the Bank of Canada's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). The question will resolve as NO if Sánchez leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024. For the purpose of this question, temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

question.title: Will Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024 and will Pedro Sánchez leave the position of Prime Minister of Spain by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Boris Johnson continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of the UK through July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official UK government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, AFP). Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position. (2) Pedro Sánchez leaves or is removed from the position of Prime Minister of Spain at any point before or during July 2024. Confirmation must come from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position. The question will resolve as NO if either Boris Johnson does not remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024 or Pedro Sánchez does not leave the position of Prime Minister of Spain by July 2024.

question.title: Will either Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain or Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024, with confirmation from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP), or (b) Boris Johnson continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of the UK through July 31, 2024, with confirmation from official UK government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, AFP). The question will resolve as NO if neither Sánchez nor Johnson remains in their respective positions through July 2024. Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position for either leader.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Missouri conducts a referendum on abortion rights and (2) Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is not declared constitutional?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

2. Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is not declared constitutional. This resolves as YES if:
   - No court ruling confirms the constitutionality of the ban by the specified date.
   - There is no confirmation of constitutionality reported by at least two reputable national news sources.
   If the ban is declared unconstitutional, or if there is no confirmation of constitutionality, this part resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

Both conditions must be met for the overall question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional or Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

1. A court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

2. Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri, the primary focus must be on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce a new digital payment system by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces the launch of a new digital payment system. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of South Korea. The announcement should explicitly state the introduction of the digital payment system. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of South Korea does not announce a new digital payment system, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, and (b) The Central Bank of South Korea does not announce a new digital payment system by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) The Central Bank of Mexico must officially announce a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The Central Bank of South Korea must not officially announce the launch of a new digital payment system by August 31, 2024. If no announcement is made from an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of South Korea, explicitly stating the introduction of the digital payment system, or if the announcement is not reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times), then this part resolves as YES. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if both (a) the Central Bank of Mexico announces the interest rate cut by the specified date and (b) the Central Bank of South Korea does not announce the new digital payment system by the specified date. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of South Korea announce a new digital payment system by August 2024, or the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea officially announces the launch of a new digital payment system by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of South Korea. The announcement should explicitly state the introduction of the digital payment system and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. If neither of these announcements is made by the respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will China's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Samsung announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024 (b) China's central bank's preferred inflation measure never shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) By July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.
(b) China's central bank's preferred inflation measure does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. If such an increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.
If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either China's inflation measure show a monthly increase over 0.5% or Samsung announce plans to increase its AI workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). (b) Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points and the Central Bank of Indonesia not announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) At any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia does not officially announce a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia, and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to resolve as NO. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024, or the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (b) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Green Acres Co. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The FDA issues a recall for ground basil products due to lead contamination, and (b) Green Acres Co. is not officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) Green Acres Co. is not officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The absence of a link must be confirmed by the lack of reports from U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and not reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak or the FDA issue a recall for ground basil due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (b) The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Bayer allows generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024, and (b) Nigeria's Senate fails to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:
1. No bill related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, is passed by the Senate.
2. Or, if a bill is passed by the Senate, it is not opposed by President Tinubu or his administration as clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
3. Or, the bill is not described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.
If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this part resolves as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024, or will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan is canceled, and (2) TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are not reported for spreading election misinformation?
question.body:
(1) The Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan will be considered canceled if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, this condition is not met. For the purpose of this condition, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

(2) TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations will be considered not reported for spreading election misinformation if, by August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this condition, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this condition is met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation, or (b) the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) It is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, this part resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

If either (a) or (b) occurs, the question will resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Colorado state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024 and will Spain maintain export taxes on some or all agricultural products beyond July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, this part resolves as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government does not officially announce or implement a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, this part resolves as YES. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will be sufficient for a YES resolution. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.
