question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Missouri-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

(b) Missouri does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Land O'Frost issues a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak and (b) the WHO does not declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over?

   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over. This includes scenarios where no declaration is made, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).

If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not fall below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or the absence of reports from at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC indicating a drop below 5.0%. If the rate falls below 5.0% by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will be considered as not falling below 5.0%.

question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 22-week limit. (2) By July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy remains in effect and is not repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The continued enforcement of the law must be confirmed by the absence of official state announcements or lack of reports by at least two reputable news sources indicating its repeal or invalidation. If the law is overturned as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'remain in effect' means the law is still enforceable in its current form, with no legislative action or judicial decision rendering it void.

   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The criteria for this are:

   2. There must be no official announcement from any state government or state's Medicaid agency, and no consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post).
   3. The plan must not be officially adopted, only proposed or under consideration.
   If another state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama, and (b) The World Health Organization does not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For this to be considered confirmed:
   1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
   2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
   3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
   4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
   5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.
   If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this condition will be NO.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. This requires:
   - The absence of such a declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or lack of reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).
   - The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.
   If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will be YES.

The question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met by the specified date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Brazil's monthly job growth falls below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024 (b) The Central Bank of Chile does not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

The interest rate in question refers to the policy rate, which is the SNB's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will either the Swiss National Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024, or will Brazil's monthly job growth fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Swiss National Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Swiss National Bank announces an interest rate cut (b) The Indian economy enters a recession?

(b) The Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024, and (b) Illinois does not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?

(b) By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, or must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if either (a) no other state adopts such a Medicaid plan by July 31, 2024, or (b) Illinois officially announces or conducts a healthcare reform referendum by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will either Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024, or will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. 2. The South Korean economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The recession must occur at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of the conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024, or will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

1. The South Korean economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024. For this to happen, the South Korean economy must not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. The WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN) and must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

The question resolves as NO if neither of these conditions is met.

question.title: Will a new AI platform be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in San Francisco, and (2) Indiana's near-total abortion ban is declared unconstitutional?

(2) A court ruling confirms the unconstitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is declared constitutional by the specified date, this condition will not be met. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

question.title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on cannabis regulation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address cannabis regulation, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on cannabis does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) New York holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, and (b) Colorado does not hold a referendum on cannabis regulation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New York state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New York-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New York and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition is not met. Note that this condition only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome. (b) By August 31, 2024, Colorado does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. This includes situations where no statewide vote is organized by the state government, or if any planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024. The referendum must be a specific vote on cannabis regulation, not just a general election with candidates having differing stances on cannabis. If such a referendum occurs by the specified date, this condition is not met. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The UK House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by PM Sunak by August 2024, and (b) Uber lays off fewer than 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Uber confirms fewer than 1,800 employees laid off as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or if no confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). If Uber confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023, the question will resolve as NO.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, this question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the median Canadian home price reaches a new record high and (b) U.S. previously occupied home sales do not show a decline for two consecutive months?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. This must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. The record must be in nominal terms, not adjusted for inflation. (b) There are no two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. This must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts, with declines reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will US airline mechanics remain on strike through August 2024?

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The U.S. economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The question resolves as NO if either the U.S. economy experiences a recession as defined, or NTT Group publicly confirms the payment specifically for erasing sensitive data.

question.title: Will JBS USA recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, JBS USA announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Georgia state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Florida maintains its current legal stance on abortion access and (b) Georgia does not hold a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Florida Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. This will be determined based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Georgia state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The non-occurrence or incompletion of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If either Florida alters its legal stance or Georgia holds a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the Department of Education's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Department of Education compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Stanford University will fully cover tuition for undergraduate students from lower-income families by July 2024, and (b) the U.S. Senate will fail to pass a bill to cut the Department of Education's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?

The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. (b) This part will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate does not pass a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Department of Education compared to its current fiscal year's budget. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate for the original question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Chile announces an interest rate cut and (b) The Reserve Bank of India does not announce an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Chile officially announces a decrease in its monetary policy interest rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Chile or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of the Central Bank and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Chile members will not count for resolution. (b) The Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed by the lack of official statements from the Reserve Bank of India and the absence of reports by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). If no formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee to cut the interest rate is communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting, this part resolves as YES. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Minnesota conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Minnesota.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the condition is not met. 'Overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part resolves as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

question.title: Will Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy publicly condemn a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is reported to have publicly condemned a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv. The condemnation must meet the following criteria:

1. It must be made by Volodymyr Zelenskyy in his capacity as the President of Ukraine.
2. It must specifically refer to an aerial attack or military action by Russia against Kyiv.
3. The condemnation must be publicly accessible, such as through official government statements, press conferences, or social media posts from verified accounts.
4. The condemnation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, Al Jazeera).

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. No such condemnation meeting the above criteria is reported by August 31, 2024.
2. Zelenskyy is no longer the President of Ukraine by the resolution date.
3. The reported condemnation is later proven to be false or misattributed.

Note: This question does not require the attack to be new or future; it could be a condemnation of any Russian aerial attack on Kyiv, including ongoing conflicts or past events, as long as the condemnation itself occurs within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Germany maintain its ban on nuclear power through August 2024 AND Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy not publicly condemn a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Germany maintains its ban on nuclear power without officially reversing it or making changes that would effectively allow nuclear power. Confirmation must come from official government sources or at least two reputable international news organizations.

2. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy does not publicly condemn a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv. The lack of condemnation must be corroborated by at least two reputable international news sources and meet the following criteria:
   - No public condemnation is made by Zelenskyy in his capacity as President.
   - No specific reference to an aerial attack or military action by Russia against Kyiv in any condemnation.
   - No publicly accessible condemnation exists, such as through official statements, press conferences, or social media from verified accounts.

The question resolves as NO if either:
- Germany reverses or significantly weakens its nuclear power ban by August 2024.
- Zelenskyy publicly condemns a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv, or he is no longer President by the resolution date, or the reported lack of condemnation is proven false or misattributed.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy publicly condemns a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv, or (b) Germany reverses its ban on nuclear power?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is reported to have publicly condemned a Russian aerial attack on Kyiv. The condemnation must meet the following criteria:
   1. It must be made by Volodymyr Zelenskyy in his capacity as the President of Ukraine.
   2. It must specifically refer to an aerial attack or military action by Russia against Kyiv.
   3. The condemnation must be publicly accessible, such as through official government statements, press conferences, or social media posts from verified accounts.

   2. Zelenskyy is no longer the President of Ukraine by the resolution date.

(b) The government of Germany officially reverses its existing ban on nuclear power. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively allow the use of nuclear power. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow nuclear power before or during August 2024, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as NO if neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak, not a global COVID-19 situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about COVID-19 that does not specifically address the Middle Eastern outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Indiana's Medicaid expansion program enrolls over 200,000 people by July 2024, AND (b) the WHO not declare the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Indiana's Medicaid expansion program enrolls more than 200,000 residents by July 31, 2024. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

2. The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East is no longer considered a global emergency by August 31, 2024. The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East is no longer a global emergency, nor should any declaration made by the WHO specifically refer to the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak as no longer being a global emergency. The WHO should maintain or escalate the emergency status of the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak.

The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) WHO declares the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak no longer a global emergency, or (b) Indiana's Medicaid expansion enrolls over 200,000 people?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the COVID-19 outbreak in the Middle East is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Middle Eastern COVID-19 outbreak, not a global COVID-19 situation in general.
   
(b) By July 31, 2024, Indiana's Medicaid expansion program enrolls more than 200,000 residents. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of these conditions is met by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will the Dream Chaser spacecraft complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Dream Chaser spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Dream Chaser spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by Sierra Nevada Corporation or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Dream Chaser spacecraft is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The United States and South Korea announce a new form of cooperation by July 2024, and (2) The Dream Chaser spacecraft fails a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, the United States and South Korea publicly announce the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. This announcement must be confirmed by official statements from either the US or South Korean government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news agencies of either country). A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023, including but not limited to joint ventures in emerging technologies, novel trade agreements, or innovative cultural exchange programs.

2. By August 31, 2024, the Dream Chaser spacecraft does not successfully complete a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. This means that either no mission involving the Dream Chaser spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth occurs, any attempted mission does not land safely with all crew members in good health, or the mission's success is not officially confirmed by Sierra Nevada Corporation or another authoritative space agency and reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

If both conditions are met by their respective dates, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Dream Chaser spacecraft completes a crewed return mission from the ISS, or (b) The United States and South Korea implement a new form of cooperation?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) The Dream Chaser spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth by August 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
- The mission must involve the Dream Chaser spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
- The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good health.
- The mission's success must be officially confirmed by Sierra Nevada Corporation or another authoritative space agency.

(b) The United States and South Korea publicly announce the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan by July 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
- The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from either the US or South Korean government.
- It must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news agencies of either country).
- A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023. This could include joint ventures in emerging technologies, novel trade agreements, or innovative cultural exchange programs.

If neither of these events occur by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Vietnam eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Vietnamese government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Thailand eliminate and Vietnam maintain export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Thai government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products, confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions or eliminations on only some products will not suffice for a YES resolution for Thailand. (b) The Vietnamese government does not officially announce or implement a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on all agricultural products. If no official government communications or reports by at least two reputable international news outlets confirm the complete elimination of export taxes on all agricultural products, or if only partial reductions or eliminations on some products occur, Vietnam maintains its export taxes. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Vietnam or Thailand eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either the Vietnamese or Thai government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. For Vietnam, the policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Similarly, for Thailand, the policy must also be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets. Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution for either country. If neither country introduces or implements such a policy by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken by both, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Department of Energy or the President's office, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the Pentagon's budget by more than 20% by August 2024 and (b) The United States does not announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, the U.S. Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the Department of Defense's budget compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). (b) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. government does not officially announce plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. No announcement from an official government source, such as the Department of Energy or the President's office, should be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg) indicating an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned. If any announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, this condition is still met. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United States announces plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two, or (b) The U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the Pentagon's budget by more than 20%?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Department of Energy or the President's office, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. (b) By August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Department of Defense (Pentagon) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Microsoft has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Microsoft confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut by August 2024 (b) Microsoft lays off fewer than 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy. (2) By July 31, 2024, Microsoft has NOT confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This includes scenarios where Microsoft confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Portland by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Portland, Oregon. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Portland rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the United Auto Workers endorse Joe Biden for president by July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris NOT announce her running mate at a rally in Portland by August 2024?

(b) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Portland, Oregon, with the non-announcement confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News within 24 hours of the rally. question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Portland by August 2024, or (b) the United Auto Workers endorse Joe Biden for president by July 2024?

question.title: Will North Carolina enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of North Carolina enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local North Carolina news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in North Carolina. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Maryland holds a referendum on abortion rights, and (b) North Carolina fails to enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (a) Maryland officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution, as verified by formal announcement from the Maryland state government and at least two major news organizations. The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and focus primarily on abortion rights. (b) The state of North Carolina does not enact a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth, as confirmed by official state legislative records and the absence of reports by at least two major news outlets. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) North Carolina enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth, or (b) Maryland holds a referendum on abortion rights?

The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and focus primarily on abortion rights. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sam Bankman-Fried face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings are initiated against Sam Bankman-Fried, as confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from and unrelated to any previous bankruptcy cases. If no such new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, 'new bankruptcy proceedings' refer to any formal legal action filed in a bankruptcy court that names Sam Bankman-Fried as the debtor, whether it's a voluntary filing by Bankman-Fried himself or an involuntary petition filed by creditors.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Argentina's Leliq rate remains at or above 75.00% in August 2024, and (b) Sam Bankman-Fried does not face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of Argentina's Leliq rate is reported to be at or above 75.00% at any point during August 2024, as confirmed by official Central Bank of Argentina announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, La Nacion). If the rate decreases below 75.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition is not met. (b) No new bankruptcy proceedings are initiated against Sam Bankman-Fried by July 31, 2024, as confirmed by the absence of official court records or lack of reports by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). 'New bankruptcy proceedings' refer to any formal legal action filed in a bankruptcy court that names Sam Bankman-Fried as the debtor, whether it's a voluntary filing by Bankman-Fried himself or an involuntary petition filed by creditors. If any such proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, this condition is not met. The question resolves as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If no additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, or if the implementations are for different waiting periods, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) New York conducts a referendum on abortion rights, and (b) no additional U.S. state implements a 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution on this part, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) No additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases. For a YES resolution on this part, no additional state must adopt such a measure by the resolution date. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify.

If both (a) and (b) occur by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either (a) or (b) does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the American Federation of Teachers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

question.title: Will Washington hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and will the American Federation of Teachers not endorse any candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Israel and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Israel's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on HDFC Bank's lending and will the Central Bank of Israel not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online gambling operations by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online gambling operations in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these gambling outfits. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online gambling operations in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) There are no confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online gambling operations in the Philippines, meaning either no reports from at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) confirm such enforcement, or the enforcement does not involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for at least 50% of known Chinese-run online gambling operations in the Philippines. Alternatively, if shutdowns are due to voluntary closures or economic factors, and not a government directive, the condition is satisfied. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Microsoft has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Microsoft confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Microsoft lays off fewer than 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. (b) Microsoft has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. If Microsoft confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will large protests occur in Turkey in response to changes in media censorship laws by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Turkey specifically in response to changes in media censorship laws. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Turkey. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of media censorship law changes. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the law change is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Azerbaijan becomes a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024, and (b) no large protests occur in Turkey in response to changes in media censorship laws by July 2024?

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for Frito-Lay snacks by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Frito-Lay snacks compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. question.title: Will Wisconsin remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Wisconsin officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, and (b) Wisconsin retains the work requirement in its Medicaid plan past July 2024?

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas distribution projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at distributing liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG distribution project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A major Chinese battery company begins construction of a factory in Ohio by August 2024, and (2) the U.S. government does not resume consideration of liquefied natural gas distribution projects by July 2024?
question.body:

(1) By August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Ohio, owned by a Chinese company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Ohio state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the condition is not met.

(2) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has not officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at distributing liquefied natural gas (LNG). The lack of resumption must be confirmed through the absence of official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The pause on consideration should remain in effect, and there should be no active processing or review of LNG distribution project applications by relevant federal agencies. If such resumption occurs by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case regarding abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that merely scheduling a referendum is not sufficient for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Tennessee holds a referendum on labor laws (b) Missouri does not hold a referendum on abortion rights?

The referendum must be officially announced by the Tennessee Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of labor laws. (b) Missouri does not hold a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. This includes if no referendum is scheduled, if a scheduled referendum is canceled, or if a referendum is scheduled but not completed by the specified date. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels for a NO resolution in Missouri. The question will resolve as NO if either Tennessee does not hold the specified referendum on labor laws or Missouri holds the specified referendum on abortion rights by the specified date.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
