If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy.

If he is no longer serving as President by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting President appointments will not be considered as Draghi remaining in the position. (b) The Central Bank of Russia officially announces a ruble stabilization program by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Russia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Russia. The announcement should explicitly state the measures intended to stabilize the ruble. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Russia does not announce such a program, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Florida enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Florida news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Arizona enacts legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, and (b) Florida refrains from enacting legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces and be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). (b) Florida does not officially pass and enact legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, this part will resolve as YES. For a NO resolution, the new law in Florida must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Florida news outlets). If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Florida or Arizona enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either Florida or Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law in either state must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Florida or Arizona news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date in either state, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Tennessee hold a referendum on healthcare funding by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee holds a referendum on enshrining healthcare funding in its state constitution. The occurrence must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the funding of healthcare in the state constitution. If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional funding of healthcare, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The United Auto Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) Tennessee does not hold a referendum on healthcare funding?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The United Auto Workers (UAW) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution. (b) Tennessee does not hold a referendum on enshrining healthcare funding in its state constitution. The absence of such a referendum must be confirmed through official state announcements or lack of coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional funding of healthcare, this part resolves as YES. The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Tennessee holds a referendum on healthcare funding or (b) the United Auto Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election?

question.title: Will Florida's abortion law allowing procedures up to 15 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 15 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Florida newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 15-week limit.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Wisconsin enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024 and (b) Florida's abortion law allowing procedures up to 15 weeks be changed by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Wisconsin: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Wisconsin enacts new laws or regulations imposing stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers, confirmed by official state legislative documentation or at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted, or if they apply equally to all healthcare providers, this resolves as NO.

(b) Florida: This resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida's abortion law permitting abortions up to 15 weeks is modified, replaced, or overturned, confirmed by official state legislative records or at least two major news outlets. If the law remains unchanged, this resolves as NO. Changes may either restrict or expand the current 15-week limit.

question.title: Will either Florida's abortion law allowing procedures up to 15 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024, or will Wisconsin enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Florida's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 15 weeks remains in effect without any changes by August 31, 2024. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Florida newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, this component resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 15-week limit. (b) Wisconsin enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers by July 31, 2024. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this component will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the EPA's Clean Power Plan be reinstated by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Environmental Protection Agency's Clean Power Plan, which was previously repealed, is reinstated through legal or administrative means. Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the EPA, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If the plan is not reinstated and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original plan that still substantially achieve its goals would qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United Nations announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024, and (b) The EPA's Clean Power Plan not be reinstated by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official UN channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the UN fleet or directly associated with UN transportation. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Environmental Protection Agency's Clean Power Plan, which was previously repealed, is not reinstated through legal or administrative means. There must be no official announcements by the EPA, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources confirming reinstatement, and no reports by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times) that the plan is reinstated and in effect. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) The EPA's Clean Power Plan be reinstated by August 2024, or (b) The United Nations announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by their respective deadlines: (a) The Environmental Protection Agency's Clean Power Plan, which was previously repealed, is reinstated through legal or administrative means by August 31, 2024. Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the EPA, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original plan that still substantially achieve its goals would qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The United Nations officially announces by July 31, 2024, that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official UN channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the UN fleet or directly associated with UN transportation. If neither event occurs by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai initiate a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hyundai has officially announced and begun the process of recalling more than 720,000 vehicles due to an issue with the seatbelt system. The recall must be specifically related to seatbelts that may not properly secure passengers, as mentioned in the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) report. Confirmation of the recall initiation must come from official Hyundai statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources. The question resolves as NO if Hyundai has not announced or begun such a recall by the specified date, or if the number of vehicles affected is 720,000 or fewer.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Hyundai's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024 (b) Hyundai does not initiate a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Hyundai reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO. Note that this part does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe. (2) By August 31, 2024, Hyundai has not officially announced or begun the process of recalling more than 720,000 vehicles due to an issue with the seatbelt system. Alternatively, it resolves as YES if the recall is not specifically related to seatbelts that may not properly secure passengers, as mentioned in the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) report. Confirmation of the lack of recall initiation must come from the absence of official Hyundai statements or the lack of reports by at least two reputable news sources. This part resolves as NO if Hyundai has announced and begun such a recall by the specified date, and the number of vehicles affected is more than 720,000. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Hyundai initiate a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024, or (b) Hyundai's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Hyundai officially announces and begins the recall process of more than 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 31, 2024. The recall must be related to seatbelts that may not properly secure passengers, as noted in NHTSA reports, with confirmation from official Hyundai statements or at least two reputable news sources. (b) Hyundai reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources. The question resolves as NO if neither event occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Stellantis receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Stellantis is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Stellantis' official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse Elizabeth Warren for president by July 2024 and Stellantis not receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?

The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If Stellantis is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in such grants by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Stellantis' official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Hormel Foods issues a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak and (b) the WHO maintains or escalates the global emergency status of the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following events occur:

(a) Hormel Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:
   1. An official announcement on Hormel Foods' website or social media channels
   2. A press release from Hormel Foods
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hormel Foods recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO does not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

If both (a) and (b) occur by the specified date, the question will resolve as YES. If either one or both do not occur, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024, or will Hormel Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

1. The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For this to be considered a YES:
   - The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   - This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

2. Hormel Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. For this to be considered a YES:
   - An official announcement must be made on Hormel Foods' website or social media channels, or a press release from Hormel Foods, or an announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hormel Foods recall.
   - Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources must confirm the recall.
   - The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of these events occurs by the specified date.

question.title: Will Meta announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Meta publicly announces a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Facebook and Twitter receive final regulatory approval for their proposed merger by August 2024, and (2) Meta does not announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
question.body:
(1) Facebook and Twitter must receive final regulatory approval from all necessary U.S. government agencies for their proposed merger by August 31, 2024. This approval must be confirmed through official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). If any regulatory body rejects the merger or if final approval is not obtained by the specified date, this condition is not met.

(2) Meta must not publicly announce a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting by July 31, 2024. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this condition is met.

Both conditions must be satisfied for the combined question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either Meta announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024 or Facebook and Twitter receive final regulatory approval for their proposed merger by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Meta publicly announces a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). The approval must be confirmed through official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). If any regulatory body rejects the merger or if final approval is not obtained by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Brazilian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Brazilian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Brazilian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Hang Seng Index reaches or exceeds 30,000 points by August 2024 and (b) the Brazilian economy enters a recession by July 2024?
question.body: (a) The Hang Seng Index must reach or exceed 30,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, based on official reports from sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution. (b) The Brazilian economy must experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth by July 31, 2024, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics. Both conditions must be met for a YES resolution; otherwise, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Brazilian economy avoid a recession by July 2024 or the Hang Seng Index reach or exceed 30,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Brazilian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics, occurring between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Hang Seng Index reaches or exceeds 30,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 30,000 points. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Turkey's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Turkey's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Turkey or a relevant Turkish government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Hurriyet Daily News). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will both the German economy avoid a recession and the Central Bank of Turkey's preferred inflation measure never show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The German economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Turkey's preferred inflation measure does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This must be confirmed by the absence of official publications by the Central Bank of Turkey or any relevant Turkish government agency, and not reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Hurriyet Daily News). If such an increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this condition focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Turkey's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% (b) The German economy avoids a recession?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 
(a) The Central Bank of Turkey's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Turkey or a relevant Turkish government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Hurriyet Daily News). 
(b) The German economy does not enter a recession, where a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. 
If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.

3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The mpox outbreak in Spain is declared over by July 2024 and (2) The WHO does not declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The mpox outbreak in Spain is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO) by July 31, 2024. This declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN).

2. By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. Specifically, the WHO does not make a public announcement stating the outbreak is no longer a global emergency, or any declaration made is not reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN), or the WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status.

The question will resolve as NO if either of the conditions is not met.

question.title: Will either the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024, or the mpox outbreak in Spain be declared over by July 2024?

The question will resolve as NO if neither of these declarations is made by their respective dates.

question.title: Will South Carolina implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Carolina has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local South Carolina newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut; (b) South Carolina does not implement a free community college plan?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. (b) South Carolina has not officially implemented a free community college plan. This includes scenarios where no students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local South Carolina newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 6.2% and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims never exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Italy's Senate passes a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Meloni and (b) the Central Bank of Nigeria's monetary policy rate decreases below 14.00% at any point in August?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Italy's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni or her administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from Prime Minister Meloni or her administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Italian economy.
   If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The Central Bank of Nigeria's monetary policy rate decreases below 14.00% at any point during August 2024 and remains below this level throughout the month. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Nigeria announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian Nigeria). If the rate is reported to be at or above 14.00% at any point during August 2024, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

(a) This part of the question will resolve as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, include insulin and are confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of insulin must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If insulin is not included in the negotiated prices by this date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brown University does not officially implement a policy to fully cover tuition for medical students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. This includes scenarios where there is no confirmation from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press), or if the policy is not in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. The question also resolves as YES if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified. If the policy is confirmed to be in place by the resolution date with the specified details, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES. Otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing safety protocols by August 2024?

The agreement should directly address the issue of safety protocols for train engineers, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address safety protocols, the question will resolve as NO.

(2) Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers do not publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses safety protocols for engineers. question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. administrative law judges be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. administrative law judges is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting administrative law judges. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The North Carolina Senate passes a total abortion ban, and (2) No enforceable ethics code for U.S. administrative law judges is established?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

1. The North Carolina Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. This refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official North Carolina legislative records. The question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

2. No enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. administrative law judges is officially adopted by the United States government. This lack of adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting administrative law judges, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. Mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

If either of these conditions is not met by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Frontier Communications emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Frontier Communications officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows Frontier Communications to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If Frontier Communications remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The French President's Office announces conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel, and (b) Spain does not announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two?

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Mexico's Senate passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President López Obrador, and (b) the Central Bank of the Philippines does not announce an interest rate cut?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Mexico's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador or his administration. To qualify:
   - The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   - It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   - The opposition from President López Obrador or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Mexican economy.
   - If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this condition resolves as NO.

2. The Central Bank of the Philippines does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The absence of such an announcement must be confirmed by the lack of official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this condition resolves as YES. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself does not occur by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

2. Mexico's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President López Obrador or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Mexican economy.

If neither of these events occurs by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Ohio hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Ohio officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on healthcare reform. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address healthcare reform, either proposing new policies or altering existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on healthcare does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Oregon holds a referendum on abortion rights and (2) Ohio does not hold a referendum on healthcare reform?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
   - The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   - It resolves as NO if no such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024, a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   
2. Ohio does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on healthcare reform. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - No referendum should be planned, or if planned, it is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024.
   - The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels.
   - The referendum topic must directly address healthcare reform, either proposing new policies or altering existing ones.
   - It resolves as NO if such a referendum does occur by the specified date.

The overall question resolves as NO if either Oregon does not hold the specified referendum on abortion rights or Ohio does hold the specified referendum on healthcare reform by August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will either Ohio hold a referendum on healthcare reform or Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either of the following occurs: 

(a) Ohio officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on healthcare reform. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address healthcare reform, either proposing new policies or altering existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on healthcare does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government, explicitly addressing the issue of abortion rights protection, with results publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. This part resolves as NO if no such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024, a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

The overall question resolves as YES if at least one of the above referendums occurs within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Arkansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arkansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Arkansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kentucky holds a referendum on pension reform by August 2024, and (b) Arkansas does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Kentucky officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on pension reform by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address pension reform, either proposing new policies or modifying existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on pensions does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. (2) Arkansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights by July 31, 2024. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Arkansas state government or the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The non-occurrence or lack of completion of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition fails, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Arkansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, or Kentucky hold a referendum on pension reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Arkansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. This referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws, officially announced by the Arkansas state government, and completed by the resolution date, with the occurrence and results reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). (b) By August 31, 2024, Kentucky officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on pension reform. This must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, with results publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels, directly addressing pension reform by proposing new policies or modifying existing ones. If neither of these referendums occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Huawei announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce and (b) the Canadian economy enters a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Huawei publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Huawei only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the condition is not met. Note that this condition is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans. (b) The Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The condition is met if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy enters a recession as defined by two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will either the Canadian economy avoid a recession or Huawei announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) Huawei publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce through official company channels or is reported by at least two major news outlets. The announcement must explicitly state an increase in AI-related workforce and must be made by the specified date. If neither of these events occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc. announce a merger agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc. publicly announce a merger agreement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from either company or reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This question does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut by August 2024 (b) ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc. do not announce a merger agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc. do not publicly announce a merger agreement by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed by the lack of official statements from either company or reports by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times) confirming such a merger agreement. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc. announce a merger agreement by July 2024, or will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc. publicly announce a merger agreement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from either company or reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This question does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Washington hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Washington officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Washington state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee's Medicaid plan with work requirements enrolls at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024 (b) Washington does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Tennessee Department of Health, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Washington does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the Washington state government by August 31, 2024.
2. The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) Washington holds a referendum on abortion rights, or (b) Tennessee's Medicaid plan with work requirements enrolls at least 25,000 beneficiaries?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by the specified dates:

(a) Washington conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Washington state government, explicitly addressing the issue of abortion rights protection, with results publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) Tennessee's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, enrolls at least 25,000 low-income residents by July 31, 2024. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Tennessee Department of Health, or at least three widely recognized news sources. The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the mpox outbreak in Argentina be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Argentina is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Spanish economy avoid a recession and the mpox outbreak in Argentina not be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Spanish economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics of Spain, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The mpox outbreak in Argentina is not officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with no declaration reported by at least two reputable international news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (1) the mpox outbreak in Argentina is declared over, or (2) the Spanish economy avoids a recession?

(2) The Spanish economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics of Spain. question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. administrative law judges be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. administrative law judges is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting administrative law judges. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mississippi's 6-week abortion ban is overturned, and (b) no enforceable ethics code for U.S. administrative law judges is established?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (1) Mississippi's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. For the purpose of this condition, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision. (2) No enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. administrative law judges is officially adopted by the United States government. If such a code is not confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press), or if the code is not legally binding and applicable to all sitting administrative law judges, or if it does not outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement, then this condition is met. Mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable. If both conditions are satisfied by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either an enforceable ethics code for U.S. administrative law judges be established or Mississippi's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) An enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. administrative law judges is officially adopted by the United States government. This adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting administrative law judges, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. Mere proposals or discussions do not qualify; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable. (b) Mississippi's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. 'Overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision. If neither event occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Harvard University remove Arthur Sackler's name from any of its buildings by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Harvard University officially announces the removal of Arthur Sackler's name from any of its campus buildings. The announcement must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The removal must be specifically for Arthur Sackler's name, not other members of the Sackler family. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Harvard explicitly states they will not remove the name by this date, the question resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The University of Sydney removes any name from its buildings due to historical controversies, and (b) Harvard University does not remove Arthur Sackler's name from any of its buildings?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The University of Sydney officially announces the removal of any name from any of its campus buildings specifically due to historical controversies. This announcement must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). If no such announcement is made, or if Sydney explicitly states they will not remove any such names by this date, this part resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a YES resolution. (b) Harvard University does not officially announce the removal of Arthur Sackler's name from any of its campus buildings. If Harvard explicitly states they will not remove the name by this date, this part also resolves as YES. The announcement or lack thereof must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If such an announcement of removal is made, this part resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a YES resolution. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied by the resolution date.

question.title: Will either Harvard University remove Arthur Sackler's name from any of its buildings or the University of Sydney remove any name from its buildings due to historical controversies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Harvard University officially announces the removal of Arthur Sackler's name from any of its campus buildings. question.title: Will the Arkansas Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Arkansas legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Virginia holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 (b) The Arkansas Senate fails to pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Virginia holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. A 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal regarding abortion rights, and the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe. (2) By July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate does not successfully pass legislation enacting a total abortion ban. A 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The failure to pass such legislation must be confirmed through official Arkansas legislative records. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Arkansas pass a total abortion ban in the Senate by July 2024 or Virginia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. A 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage must be confirmed through official Arkansas legislative records. (b) By August 31, 2024, Virginia holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law.
