If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia hold a referendum on privacy rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia holds a referendum on enshrining privacy rights in its state constitution. The occurrence must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the protection of privacy rights in the state constitution. If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional protection of privacy rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iowa's near-total abortion ban is declared constitutional by August 2024 and (b) Virginia does not hold a referendum on privacy rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Iowa's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Iowa state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this condition is not met. For the purpose of this condition, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. (b) By July 31, 2024, Virginia does not hold a referendum on enshrining privacy rights in its state constitution. The lack of occurrence must be confirmed through the absence of official state announcements or lack of coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). Alternatively, if a referendum is held but does not specifically address the protection of privacy rights in the state constitution, this condition is met. If such a referendum is held by the resolution date, and it specifically addresses constitutional protection of privacy rights, this condition is not met. The question resolves as NO if either or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Virginia hold a referendum on privacy rights by July 2024, or Iowa's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Virginia holds a referendum on enshrining privacy rights in its state constitution. This must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations. The referendum must specifically address the protection of privacy rights in the state constitution. (b) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Iowa's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Iowa state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources. If neither event occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Barclays Bank issue pass-through certificates worth at least $1 billion by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Barclays Bank issues pass-through certificates with a total value of at least $1 billion (or its equivalent in Indian Rupees) as part of a loan sale. The issuance must be confirmed through official announcements by Barclays Bank or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The pass-through certificates must be issued as part of a strategy to manage the bank's loan portfolio or address funding gaps. If no such issuance meeting these criteria occurs by the specified date, or if the total value is less than $1 billion, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The U.S. economy avoids a recession by July 2024 (b) Barclays Bank issues pass-through certificates worth less than $1 billion by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. economy does not enter a recession. For this condition, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The question resolves as NO if the U.S. economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. 

(b) By August 31, 2024, Barclays Bank does not issue pass-through certificates with a total value of at least $1 billion (or its equivalent in Indian Rupees) as part of a loan sale. This includes scenarios where no issuance occurs or the total value of the issued certificates is less than $1 billion. The lack of issuance or insufficient value must be confirmed through the absence of official announcements by Barclays Bank or lack of reports by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). If such an issuance meeting the original criteria occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) Barclays Bank issues pass-through certificates worth at least $1 billion, or (b) the U.S. economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, Barclays Bank issues pass-through certificates with a total value of at least $1 billion (or its equivalent in Indian Rupees) as part of a loan sale. The issuance must be confirmed through official announcements by Barclays Bank or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The pass-through certificates must be issued as part of a strategy to manage the bank's loan portfolio or address funding gaps. (b) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The question resolves as NO if neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas import projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at importing liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG import project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Germany and Japan implement a new form of cooperation, and (b) the U.S. government does not resume consideration of liquefied natural gas import projects?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Germany and Japan have publicly announced the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from either the German or Japanese government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news agencies of either country). A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023. This could include, but is not limited to, joint ventures in emerging technologies, novel trade agreements, or innovative cultural exchange programs. If no such implementation is confirmed by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. (b) The U.S. federal government has not officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at importing liquefied natural gas (LNG). There should be no official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal) confirming such a resumption. The pause on consideration should remain in effect, and there should be no active processing or review of LNG import project applications by relevant federal agencies. If such a resumption occurs by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. If both (a) and (b) are true, the combined question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the U.S. government resume consideration of LNG import projects or Germany and Japan implement a new form of cooperation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at importing liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG import project applications by relevant federal agencies. (b) Germany and Japan publicly announce the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from either the German or Japanese government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news agencies of either country). A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023. This could include, but is not limited to, joint ventures in emerging technologies, novel trade agreements, or innovative cultural exchange programs. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Rand Paul publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on healthcare funding?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Rand Paul publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Minnesota enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024 and (b) Rand Paul not publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on healthcare funding by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (a) By July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Minnesota news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Minnesota. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, Rand Paul does not publicly retract or significantly alter his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. The retraction or alteration must not be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Will either Rand Paul retract his statement on Biden's healthcare stance or Minnesota modify medical care restrictions for transgender youth?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, Rand Paul publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances. (b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Minnesota news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Minnesota. If neither event occurs by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Germany appoints a new Chancellor by August 2024 and (b) The United Nations Development Programme does not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, a new Chancellor is officially appointed in Germany. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' Chancellor refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new Chancellor is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current Chancellor as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, this condition is not met. (2) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. This includes situations where no announcement is made, or the total of new funding commitments announced does not exceed $400 million. If such an announcement is made and the total exceeds $400 million, this condition is not met. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024, or (b) Germany appoint a new Chancellor by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. If neither condition is met by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the FDA issue a recall for ground paprika products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground paprika products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The WHO declares the mpox outbreak in Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024, and (2) The FDA does not issue a recall for ground paprika products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the mpox outbreak in Africa is no longer considered a global emergency by August 31, 2024. For this condition to be met:
   - The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the mpox outbreak in Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   - This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the African mpox outbreak, not a global mpox situation in general.

2. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) does not issue a recall for any ground paprika products due to lead contamination by July 31, 2024. For this condition to be met:
   - There must be an absence of official FDA announcements and reports from major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post) regarding such a recall.

The question will resolve as NO if either:
- The WHO does not make a declaration that the African mpox outbreak is no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024, or
- The FDA issues a recall for ground paprika products due to lead contamination by July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will either the FDA issue a recall for ground paprika products due to lead contamination by July 2024, or the WHO declare the mpox outbreak in Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground paprika products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the mpox outbreak in Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution, the WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the mpox outbreak in Africa is no longer a global emergency. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN). The declaration must specifically refer to the African mpox outbreak, not a global mpox situation in general. The question will resolve as NO if the WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024, makes a declaration about mpox that does not specifically address the African outbreak, or maintains or escalates the emergency status of the African mpox outbreak. Note: If the WHO has already declared the African mpox outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing job security by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses job security for engineers. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of job security for train engineers, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address job security, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Massachusetts holds a referendum on public transportation funding by July 2024, and (b) Union Pacific fails to reach a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing job security by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Massachusetts holds a referendum on enshrining public transportation funding in its state constitution. The occurrence must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the funding of public transportation in the state constitution. If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional funding of public transportation, the question resolves as NO.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers do not publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses job security for engineers. This includes scenarios where no agreement is reached, or an agreement is reached but not announced, or an agreement is announced but does not specifically address job security. If such an agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, then the question will resolve as NO. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers).

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July/August 2024: (a) Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing job security, or (b) Massachusetts holds a referendum on public transportation funding?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses job security for engineers. This agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). (b) By July 31, 2024, Massachusetts holds a referendum on enshrining public transportation funding in its state constitution. The referendum must specifically address the funding of public transportation in the state constitution.

question.title: Will Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) New Jersey holds a referendum on abortion rights, and (b) Colorado does not enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) New Jersey officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New Jersey state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New Jersey-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition is not met. (2) The state of Colorado does not enact any new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, this condition is met. The condition is not met if a new law is enacted that specifically addresses and alters the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado, with the enactment confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The question will resolve as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (1) Colorado enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth, or (2) New Jersey holds a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (1) The state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth, confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus primarily on abortion rights. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Pennsylvania enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Michigan removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan, and (b) Pennsylvania refrains from enacting new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The state of Michigan officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (b) Pennsylvania does not enact new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The absence of such enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or the lack of reports by at least two reputable news sources. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Pennsylvania enact stricter abortion regulations or Michigan remove the Medicaid work requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Pennsylvania enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. (b) Michigan officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Utah's abortion law allowing procedures up to 18 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Utah's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 18 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Utah newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 18-week limit.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kentucky enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024, and (b) Utah's abortion law allowing procedures up to 18 weeks is changed by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Kentucky enacts new laws or regulations imposing stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers, confirmed by official state legislative documentation or at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by this date, or if enacted laws apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, Utah's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 18 weeks is modified, replaced, or overturned, confirmed by official state legislative records or at least two major news outlets. Changes may either restrict or expand the current 18-week limit. If the law remains unchanged by this date, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either Utah's abortion law remain unchanged by August 2024 or Kentucky enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, Utah's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 18 weeks remains in effect without any changes, confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets. (b) By July 31, 2024, Kentucky enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers, confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. question.title: Will Pennsylvania's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Pennsylvania's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Pennsylvania state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Supreme Court justices be established by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania's near-total abortion ban not be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Supreme Court justices is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Supreme Court justices. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, this condition will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

(b) By August 31, 2024, no court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Pennsylvania's near-total abortion ban, or a court rules it unconstitutional. The lack of confirmation must be evident by the absence of reports from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers) declaring it constitutional. If the ban is declared constitutional by the specified date, this condition resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Pennsylvania's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024, or an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Supreme Court justices be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Pennsylvania's near-total abortion ban. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on education reform by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Florida holds a referendum on enshrining education reform in its state constitution. The referendum must specifically address the protection of education reform in the state constitution. If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional protection of education reform, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Wisconsin conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and (b) Florida does not hold a referendum on education reform by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Wisconsin conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Wisconsin.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Florida does not hold a referendum on enshrining education reform in its state constitution by July 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES, no such referendum should be held by the resolution date, or if held, it does not specifically address constitutional protection of education reform. The occurrence of such a referendum must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN) for this part to resolve as NO.

The combined question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) are satisfied as described above.

question.title: Will either Florida hold a referendum on education reform by July 2024, or Wisconsin conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Florida holds a referendum on enshrining education reform in its state constitution. This must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the protection of education reform in the state constitution. (b) By August 31, 2024, Wisconsin conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Wisconsin, with the primary focus on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Bed Bath & Beyond emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bed Bath & Beyond officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows Bed Bath & Beyond to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If Bed Bath & Beyond remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Frontier Communications emerges from bankruptcy and (b) Bed Bath & Beyond fails to emerge from bankruptcy?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Frontier Communications officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents, and should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows Frontier Communications to continue operations with a restructured financial position. (b) Bed Bath & Beyond remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. If Bed Bath & Beyond officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings by the specified date, with the emergence confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official company statements or court documents, and involves a court-approved reorganization plan that allows Bed Bath & Beyond to continue operations with a restructured financial position, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Bed Bath & Beyond or Frontier Communications emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either of the following occurs: (a) Bed Bath & Beyond officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Russia announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Central Bank of Russia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Russia communications, such as press releases, Board of Directors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the key rate, which is the Central Bank of Russia's primary tool for monetary policy.

(b) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For this part to resolve as YES:

1. A significant strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants) and last for at least one week, but no agreement is reached to end it by the specified date.
2. If no such strike meeting these criteria occurs, this part also resolves as YES.
3. The continuation of the strike or lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union regarding a resolution.
4. The continuation or absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If an agreement meeting all the original criteria is achieved by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

The question resolves as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Norwegian oil workers remain on strike through August 2024 and (b) the Italian economy enters a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, oil workers in Norway are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from oil companies, the unions representing the workers, or the Norwegian government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as NRK, Aftenposten, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike. (b) The Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this condition, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The condition is not met if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. The combined question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Eli Lilly allow generic production of its insulin product by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Eli Lilly officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its insulin product, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Eli Lilly continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Central Bank of South Korea announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Eli Lilly does not allow generic production of its insulin product?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of South Korea or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of South Korea members will not count for resolution. (b) Eli Lilly does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its insulin product, effectively continuing to enforce its patent. This could be due to a lack of formal patent withdrawal, absence of a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. Confirmation of non-allowance must come from the absence of official company announcements, lack of statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or no reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If either of these conditions is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Maine maintain its 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases through August 2024?

If the waiting period is repealed, reduced, or extended beyond 72 hours by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. The waiting period must apply generally to gun purchases and not be limited to specific types of firearms or specific circumstances.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada announces a reduction in its key interest rate, and (b) The average rate on a 15-year mortgage does not exceed 5.5%?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Canada and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the overnight rate, which is the BoC's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, this condition resolves as NO. (b) The average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024. Official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal must confirm the rate. If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, this condition resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, it can be equal to or less than 5.5%. If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.
